results.title: Sharking
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Centre, RMIT, Terry Walker and Rod Rees
results.brief_description: A history of the shark and of shark fishing and marketing in Australia. Shows the historical development of the Australian shark industry and the detailed research and managemnet of shark fishing resources being carried out byy the Victorian Fisheries and Wildlife Department.

results.title: Sharkey's Party
results.brief_description: Sharky’s friends throw a wild party to celebrate his homecoming after six months of psychiatric treatment. This is a satirical look at friendship in the 1980s and the “sex and drugs and rock n roll” ethos.

results.title: Shark shocker; Turning turtle
results.brief_description: Two episodes of the “Blue Wilderness” series in which Ron and Valerie Taylor investigate conservation methods for sea creatures. In “Shark shocker” they go to South Africa to see an electronic shark barrier, which may deter sharks from swimming near beaches, as an alternative to nets which trap other sea creatures. In “Turning turtle” the Taylor’s show the need for rescue work with sea turtles on Raine Island off the Queensland coast.

results.title: Shark
results.creator_credit: Roone Arledge, Learning Corporation of America and Scott Ransom
results.brief_description: Presents some of the characteristics and habits of sharks in particular the white pointer, the tiger shark, and the bronze whaler. Peter Benchley, author of “Jaws”, guides us through the ancient times to sharks to modern day. They dive near Gladstone, in Queensland, a small fishing port on the East Coast of Australia, diving in the Barrier Reef; diving also takes place in South Australia, near Seal Island.

results.title: Sharing: the School Community Library
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: In some Victorian schools joint-use libraries have already been developed where both the school and the community share the same library facilities. This film, for librarians, administrators, and educators examines the problems and advantages of the community library concept as developed at Templestowe Technical School and Nathalia Primary School.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Dodds and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Sharing the roads safely
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
investigates pedestrians, bicycles, domestic pets, and children as hazards for the driver. Suggests that accident-free driving for all vehicles sharing the road should be the aim for all people.

results.title: Sharing the Leadership
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Explores three categories of individual action and their relation to group leadership: self-serving functions, task functions and group serving functions.

results.title: Sharing the fruits of progress
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications, Weng Jeng-Yih, Samuel Wu and Roy Chin
results.brief_description: Reconstruction of Taiwan began after World War II. For a number of years Taiwan received foreign aid from countries like the United States. These monies were used to develop agricultural and industrial resources. In the 1980’s Taiwan was able to assist other countries with foriegn aid but as the country is not a member of key international organizations, it is restricted from doing more. This program examines Taiwan’s desire to “share the fruits of its progress.”
